item.title: PowerWash Simulator 2 announced for PS5, Xbox Series, and PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/powerwash-simulator-2-announced-for-ps5-xbox-series-and-pc

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Due out in late 2025.

FuturLab has announced PowerWash Simulator 2 for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC (Steam). It will launch in late 2025.

Update 11:40 a.m.: Following a Eurogamer report about a Switch 2 version also being planned, a FuturLab representative provided Gematsu with the following statement: “Whilst we would like to release on Switch 2, there are no current firm plans. We have no timeframe or news there.”

“PowerWash Simulator 2 feels like a natural evolution from its predecessor,” said FuturLab design director Dan Chequer in a press release. “The original game’s design was all about eliminating anything that detracted from the pure satisfaction of taking something dirty and making it clean. PowerWash Simulator 2 is all about adding in even more avenues for players to achieve that same sense of satisfaction, with new tools, features and quality of life improvements. We’re really excited to see players dust off their power washers and get stuck into this brand-new campaign, that brings you even more to clean, and even more ways to release the pressure.”

FuturLab chief operating officer Chris Mehers added, “We couldn’t be more thrilled to finally announce the sequel to one of our most successful titles. With over 17 million players worldwide, PowerWash Simulator has allowed us to self-publish a sequel, an exciting challenge we are delighted to undertake. We look forward to bringing players the next step-up in the PowerWash Simulator series.”

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the game, via FuturLab:

About

Return to Muckingham in PowerWash Simulator 2, a sud-tacular follow up to the worldwide pressure washing sim phenomenon that has worked gamers up into a lather since 2022.

PowerWash Simulator 2 is bubbling with fresh locations in a whole new campaign, improved visuals, soap-erior equipment and splashy features. Effortlessly transform soiled surroundings into clean, serene scenes, solo or with pals either online or—for the first time—in split-screen. Satisfaction is a spray away!

Key Features

  • Craving More to Clean? – The jobs and water keep flowing in PowerWash Simulator 2. Play through a fresh new campaign, uncovering more of Muckingham’s mysteries. Plus, venture even further out to brand-new grime-coated locations like Sponge Valley, Power Falls and Lubri City.
  • No Place Like Your Home-Base – Kick back and relax in your home-base after a hard-days-cleaning. Put down your roots and make the place yours by collecting furniture and trinkets to spruce it up along the way, then invite your power wash pals over to check out your pad.
  • Soap-erior Washing – Watch your worries melt away with each swipe of your power washer. Cleaning feels even better in PowerWash Simulator 2, including enhanced soap that clings to stubborn stains and annihilates dirt.
  • Clean in Split-Screen! – Satisfaction on the double! Share campaign progression online together for the first time. In addition to online play, split-screen cooperative play has entered the chat. Team up and take on the dirt with twice the wash-power, from the convenience of one screen.
  • There’s Lots More to Come… – Watch this space as we dish the dirt on new content and features coming in PowerWash Simulator 2!

item.title: 3D platformer and racing game crossover Pocket Wheels launches in 2026 for PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Gear up to race, explore, and collect.

Deck13 Spotlight will release Florian Wolf-developed 3D racing platformer Pocket Wheels for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam and GOG in 2026, the publisher announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its store pages:

About

Pocket Wheels is about the childhood dream of imagining adventures with your toys inside the house. It’s a 3D platformer and racing game crossover, inspired by 90s collectathons. You play as a toy car with various abilities like jumping, gliding, and even a grappling hook. There are various vehicles that you can purchase with coins in the toy garage. Coins are collected in one of the many rooms inside the fully explorable house. Every room has a different theme with various race tracks, objectives and collectibles.

Special Abilities

Use your jump ability to complete various objectives or extend your wings to get off the track and explore the different rooms. There’s even a grappling hook to get around in style!

Explore

For a small car, everyday objects can be a great challenge. AR glasses can give a new view on a room and unravel various new obstacles and objectives. And you should definitely watch out for the roomba.
